hub.title: Integrations
hub.subtitle: Add voice capture to your favorite survey platform in minutes. No development required.

common.needHelpDesc: Our AI assistant can walk you through the setup step by step.

alchemer.name: Alchemer
alchemer.tagline: Formerly SurveyGizmo. Full integration with JavaScript Actions.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Add voice responses to your Alchemer surveys in 3 simple steps. Works with all Alchemer plans that support JavaScript Actions.

steps.title: Add the script to your survey
steps.description: Go to Style > HTML/CSS Editor > Custom HEAD and paste this script tag. This only needs to be done once per survey.

steps.title: Add the container div to your question
steps.description: Edit the question text in Source/HTML view and add a container div. Change 'q1' to match your question ID in the project.

steps.title: Add a JavaScript Action
steps.description: Add an Action > JavaScript on the question page. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key from the dashboard.

mergeCode.description: Alchemer's built-in merge code that uniquely identifies each respondent session.

qualtrics.name: Qualtrics
qualtrics.tagline: Enterprise-grade survey platform. Integrate via Look & Feel and addOnReady.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Embed voice capture in your Qualtrics surveys using the Look & Feel editor and JavaScript. Works with all Qualtrics license tiers.

steps.title: Add the script in Look & Feel
steps.description: Go to Look & Feel > General > Header (click Edit) and paste this script tag. Once per survey.

steps.title: Add the container div to your question
steps.description: Edit the question text using the Rich Content Editor > Source/HTML and add the container div.

steps.title: Add JavaScript to the question
steps.description: Click the question > gear icon > Add JavaScript. Use Qualtrics' addOnReady callback. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key.

mergeCode.description: Qualtrics' embedded data field that provides the unique response ID for each survey session.

surveymonkey.name: SurveyMonkey
surveymonkey.tagline: World's most popular survey tool. Requires Premier plan or above.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Add voice responses to SurveyMonkey surveys using Custom HTML questions. Note: requires a Premier plan or above.

steps.title: Add a Custom HTML question
steps.description: In your survey editor, add a new question and select 'Custom HTML / Presentation Text' as the question type. This is available on Premier plans and above.

steps.title: Paste the complete widget code
steps.description: In the Custom HTML editor, paste the full widget embed including the script tag. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key.

mergeCode.description: SurveyMonkey merge code for the unique response identifier.

questionpro.name: QuestionPro
questionpro.tagline: Feature-rich survey platform with Custom JavaScript support.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Integrate voice capture in QuestionPro surveys using Custom JavaScript settings. Works with all plans that support custom JS.

steps.title: Add the script globally
steps.description: Go to Survey Settings > Custom JavaScript/CSS > Header JavaScript and paste the script tag.

steps.title: Add the container div to your question
steps.description: Edit the question text in HTML mode and add the container div. Change 'q1' to your question ID.

steps.title: Add JavaScript for the question
steps.description: In Custom JavaScript for the page, add the initialization code. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key.

mergeCode.description: QuestionPro's merge code for the unique response identifier.

jotform.name: JotForm
jotform.tagline: Easy-to-use form builder with Embed HTML elements.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Add voice capture to JotForm forms using the Embed / Full HTML element. Quick and simple setup.

steps.title: Add an Embed element
steps.description: In the JotForm builder, add an 'Embed / Full HTML' element to your form where you want the voice widget.

steps.title: Paste the complete widget code
steps.description: In the HTML editor, paste the full widget embed. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key from the dashboard.

mergeCode.description: JotForm's merge variable for the unique submission identifier.

wordpress.name: WordPress
wordpress.tagline: The world's most popular CMS. Integration coming soon.
wordpress.comingSoonMessage: We're working on a dedicated WordPress plugin for Voice Capture. In the meantime, you can use the generic HTML embed in any WordPress page using the HTML block.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: A dedicated WordPress plugin is in development. Stay tuned!

typeform.name: Typeform
typeform.tagline: Beautiful conversational forms. Integration coming soon.
typeform.comingSoonMessage: Typeform currently does not support custom HTML/JavaScript embedding within survey questions. We're exploring alternative integration methods.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: We're working on a Typeform integration. Stay tuned!

formstack.name: Formstack
formstack.tagline: Workflow automation with forms. Integration coming soon.
formstack.comingSoonMessage: Formstack integration is in development. We're working on a way to embed Voice Capture in Formstack forms.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: We're working on a Formstack integration. Stay tuned!

generic.name: Any Web Form
generic.tagline: Works with any website or web application that supports custom HTML.

hero.title: Voice Capture for
hero.subtitle: Embed voice capture in any HTML page, web app, or custom survey. Just add a div and a script tag.

steps.title: Add the widget HTML
steps.description: Add this code wherever you want the voice widget to appear. Replace 'proj_xxx' with your project key and 'SESSION_ID' with a unique identifier per respondent.

mergeCode.description: Replace with a unique identifier for each respondent. This could be a URL parameter, cookie value, or generated UUID.
